intro: Pseudogalium paradoxum subsp. paradoxum, commonly known as the paradoxum pseudogalium, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of South Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
